action.action-desc: Mr. Markey (for himself, Mr. Blumenthal, Ms. Hirono, Mr. Booker, and Ms. Warren) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To require the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network to issue an advisory about how homegrown violent extremists and other perpetrators of domestic terrorism procure firearms and firearm accessories, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Gun Violence Prevention Through Financial Intelligence Act.

section.header: Advisory on the procurement of firearms and firearm accessories

paragraph.text: The term domestic terrorism has the meaning given the term in section 2331 of title 18, United States Code.
The term FinCEN means the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network.
The term financial institution has the meaning given the term in section 5312(a) of title 31, United States Code.
The term firearm has the meaning given the term in section 921(a) of title 18, United States Code.

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, FinCEN shall request information from financial institutions for the purpose of developing an advisory about the identification and reporting of suspicious activity relating to—

subparagraph.text: how homegrown violent extremists and perpetrators of domestic terrorism procure firearms and firearm accessories for the purpose of carrying out lone actor or lone wolf acts of terror within the United States; and
the ways in which the firearms market in the United States is exploited to facilitate gun violence in the United States.

paragraph.text: Section 5318(g) of title 31, United States Code, shall apply to a request for information from a financial institution by FinCEN under paragraph (1) in the same manner that section applies to a requirement by the Secretary of the Treasury of a financial institution to report a suspicious transaction under that section.
In requesting information from a financial institution under paragraph (1), FinCEN shall consider the size of the financial institution and tailor the request accordingly.
Before requesting information from a financial institution under paragraph (1), FinCEN shall consult, with respect to the nature of the request, with—

subparagraph.text: the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation;
the Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives of the Department of Justice; and
sellers of firearms and firearm accessories.

paragraph.text: Not later than 540 days after the date of enactment of this Act, if FinCEN determines that the information collected under subsection (b)(1) is sufficient to develop the advisory described in that subsection, FinCEN shall issue the advisory.

Not later than 540 days after the date of enactment of this Act, if FinCEN determines that the information collected under subsection (b)(1) is not sufficient to develop the advisory described in that subsection, FinCEN shall submit to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate and the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives a report that describes—

subparagraph.text: the type information collected under subsection (b)(1);
the methodology used to collect such information;
the degree to which financial institutions provided information requested;
why such information is not sufficient to develop the advisory described in subsection (b)(1); and
any barriers to obtaining the information that is required to develop the advisory described in subsection (b)(1).
